importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Kada Scott was reported missing and the black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen, which later was linked to the case.
The date when the stolen Hyundai Accent was seen parked near where Scott’s body was found, linking it to her disappearance.
The date when the Hyundai was reported to be on fire and later found compacted at a junkyard, a key timeline point in the vehicle-related charges.
The date of the news report, when the remains were confirmed and King was formally charged with multiple offenses.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe when Scott disappeared and the stolen vehicle was seen, critical to establishing a timeline of events.
The period during which the vehicle was reported stolen, seen, and later burned, indicating possible criminal activity.

keyTakeAways: Remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old missing woman, were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and causing or risking a catastrophe.
King’s cellphone location data and video evidence suggest he had contact with Scott and used the stolen Hyundai Accent, which was seen near the location of her remains.
The remains were found after an anonymous tip prompted investigators to return to a previously searched area.
DNA tests confirmed the identity of the remains as belonging to Kada Scott.
Additional charges, including homicide, are under consideration, with prosecutors stating that other people may have been involved in the incident.
The case has significant public interest due to the emotional impact on Scott’s family and the broader community’s concern over missing persons and violent crime.
King was previously arrested in another kidnapping case, which ended without charges due to lack of witness participation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of 23-year-old Kada Scott, a woman reported missing in Philadelphia, were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school after an anonymous tip led investigators to re-examine the site. DNA tests confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and causing or risking a catastrophe. Evidence including King’s cellphone location data and surveillance footage of the stolen black Hyundai Accent—seen near the crime scene and later reported on fire—links him to the case. Prosecutors indicate that homicide charges are under consideration and that others may be involved. The case has drawn significant public attention due to the tragic nature of Scott’s disappearance and the severity of the charges against King.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
